'''''Tricholoma muscarium''''' is a mushroom found in Japan.<ref name=Takemoto>{{Cite journal | doi = 10.1248/yakushi1947.84.12_1183| title = Studies on the Constituents of Indigenous Fungi. I| journal = Yakugaku Zasshi| volume = 84| issue = 12| pages = 1183| year = 1964| last1 = Takemoto| first1 = Tsunematsu| last2 = Nakajima| first2 = Tadashi}}</ref>

==Toxicity==
''Tricholoma muscarium'' contain [[ibotenic acid]] and [[tricholomic acid]] and is considered to be an edible mushroom in Japan.<ref name=Takemoto/><ref>{{cite book|last1=Beuchat|first1=edited by Larry R.|title=Food and beverage mycology|date=1987|publisher=Van Nostrand Reinhold|location=New York, N.Y.|isbn=9780442210847|edition=2nd}}</ref>
